shortdescription: The Universidad Autónoma de Manizales (UAM) will host the 1st International Congress of Environmental Organizations, an event that will highlight Manizales as a global epicenter in the fight against climate change.

subtitle: The congress will take place from August 20 to 23, 2024, and will bring together around 100 environmental organizations.
articles.audiotitle: Information about the 1st International Congress of Environmental Organizations
articles.titledescription: Juan David Martínez provides information about the 1st International Congress of Environmental Organizations at UAM.
paragraph: From August 20 to 23, 2024, the Universidad Autónoma de Manizales (UAM) will host the 1st International Congress of Environmental Organizations. This historic event will bring together around 100 environmental organizations in Manizales, Caldas, thanks to the collaboration between Awaq Estaciones Biológicas, the Universidad Autónoma de Manizales, and the Society of Doctors and Researchers of Colombia (SoPhIC).

The main goal of the congress is to unite efforts among project-managing organizations, sustainability experts, and public and private entities to create a greener and more conscious future. The event will focus on generating strategic alliances, developing innovative solutions to combat climate change, and fostering collaboration between universities, public bodies, and private companies.

The thematic lines of the congress include sources of funding for environmental projects, biodiversity conservation, sustainability innovation, education and awareness, and policies and regulations. These topics will address everything from identifying funding for sustainability projects to discussing public policies that support environmental sustainability.

During the congress, a manifesto will be signed and presented to the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) by Awaq ONGD in its consultative member capacity. This document will reflect the commitment and actions needed to drive the transition to a more sustainable world. Interested parties can register on the congress website.

articles.audiotitle: Interview with José Serrano Serna about the International Congress of Environmental Organizations
articles.titledescription: José Serrano Serna, president of Awaq, talks about the first International Congress of Environmental Organizations in Manizales.
paragraph: José Serrano Serna, president of Awaq ONGD, spoke with LA PATRIA Radio about the first International Congress of Environmental Organizations taking place in Manizales from August 20 to 23. The congress aims to gather environmental organizations to discuss crucial issues affecting the community and the environment.

Serrano Serna explained that the lack of unity and a discussion forum for local environmental organizations motivated the creation of this congress. Supported by the Universidad Autónoma de Manizales and Sophic, the event will serve as a platform to hear from organizations and discuss with key players in the environmental field.

The congress will address topics such as access to funding, representation in public administrations, technology, and the perception of environmental organizations by private companies. The goal is to learn about best practices that could improve conservation programs and increase the visibility of environmental organizations.

Serrano Serna emphasized the importance of this event in a country like Colombia, with great biodiversity. Building networks and increasing the visibility of environmental organizations are crucial for protecting the country's natural heritage and promoting global collaboration in conservation.

articles.titledescription: Bellzmín Arenas Quintana discusses social projection initiatives at the Universidad Autónoma de Manizales
paragraph: In the interview, Bellzmín Arenas Quintana, coordinator of the Social Projection Unit at the Universidad Autónoma de Manizales, addresses the initiatives and projects the university is undertaking to contribute to social and community development.

Arenas Quintana highlights how the university is involved in various activities aimed at improving the quality of life in the region, collaborating with different organizations and entities to achieve its goals.
The importance of social projection as a tool to connect the university with the community and promote projects that benefit the most vulnerable sectors is discussed.

The interview also mentions upcoming events and planned activities, as well as the expected impact of these projects on the local community and the relationship between the university and its environment.

shortdescription: The First International Congress of Environmental Organizations will take place in Manizales in August, with the goal of bringing together and collaborating with organizations dedicated to the environment.
articles.bannerAlt: First International Congress of Environmental Organizations
articles.bannerdescription: Manizales will host the First International Congress of Environmental Organizations.
subtitle: A congress dedicated to sustainability and environmental organizations.
Focus on visibility and collaboration between organizations.
Participation of national and international organizations.
articles.audiotitle: Interview about the International Congress of Environmental Organizations
articles.titledescription: Details about the First International Congress of Environmental Organizations in Manizales
paragraph: The First International Congress of Environmental Organizations will be held in Manizales instead of Bogotá, aiming to highlight and collaborate with organizations working on various environmental issues, from water protection to wildlife.

The congress seeks to highlight the lack of funding faced by many environmental organizations and discuss topics such as environmental regulations, technology for the environment, and sustainable mining. Additionally, corporate social responsibility actions will be presented.

The event will feature participation from national and international organizations, with an emphasis on collaboration and visibility. Organizations from Spain, Chile, and Argentina are expected, along with 60% national participants.

Scheduled for the second week of August, the congress will serve as a platform for knowledge exchange and the formulation of commitments in a final manifesto. There will also be a marketplace where organizations can showcase their work and seek collaboration opportunities.
